forumNotes.author: Wonko the Sane
forumNotes.content:
Do you want to "flip the bit"?

I.e. making it "fixed" instead of "Removable"?

Start by following this:

[http://reboot.pro/to...n-datatraveler/](http://reboot.pro/topic/20176-need-tool-to-flip-the-removable-bit-on-a-kingston-datatraveler/ "")

Find and provide the info about your specific device, as in:

[http://reboot.pro/to...veler/?p=188703](http://reboot.pro/topic/20176-need-tool-to-flip-the-removable-bit-on-a-kingston-datatraveler/?p=188703 "")

**BUT**

There is **NO NEED** normally to flip the removable bit, in most cases it is unneeded, and in a few you can use a filter driver to have the devices seen as fixed in Windows NT based OS's:

[http://agnipulse.com...d-disk-windows/](http://agnipulse.com/2012/03/filter-drivers-removable-media-fixed-disk-windows/ "External link")

![:duff:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/duff.gif)

Wonko

forumNotes.author: Abdo Refky
forumNotes.content: hey . this flash memory suddenly truned to be write protected . ![:(](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/sad.png) ![:(](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/sad.png) i have tried attributes clear readonly ,,etc windows disk managment read it as not initialized . thanks

forumNotes.author: Wonko the Sane
forumNotes.content:
Hmmm. ![:dubbio:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/dubbio.gif)

If it is not initialized it is not "read only" (or not ++*only*++ "read only" if you pardon me the pun) it means that the device is \*somehow\* malfunctioning.

The "not initialized" in Disk Management is caused by "Magic Bytes" (the two bytes at offset 510 or last two bytes in the MBR) are not 55AA.

Usually (but not always) doing a low-level format with the UPTool resets the device (but the current contents of the device will be lost forever).

If - besides the Disk Management issue - you can access the device's RAW sectors, it would be a good idea to make a dd-like image of the device (if it contains or contained valuable data).

![:duff:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/duff.gif)

Wonko
